storyInfo: While inspecting PRTS, Closure recalls her first encounter with Theresa and the Doctor. After she leaves, the Doctor asks an important question.

attributes.content: Next, verify language logic function integrity.
PRTS, tell me a story.
Alright.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Ah, it's you.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: This entire time... You have been lingering there...
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Since your last visit, it has been 1555555555555—
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Hm? This sounds familiar...
—555 days.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Welcome to the Primitive Rhodes Island Terminal Service.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Confirming permissions—42.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: —Welcome, LeaderOne.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: I'm pretty sure I heard this before. Eh, seriously, I want a story, not something like this...
Please understand that this is outside my area of expertise.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Okay, okay. Let's have everyone understand each other so we'll all live a better tomorrow, right? Yeah, I get it.
Looks like the language logic is doing okay.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Now let's look at the other parts.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Is it really necessary to keep inspecting these areas for which PRTS has never reported any issues?
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Of course!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: It's been a very long time since we did any data archiving on you. This is just like the regular physicals we do on humans. Have to make sure you're healthy and all.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Programs have no concept of life.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: I kinda think you do, though.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Should I perhaps take that as a compliment?
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: May I ask a question, then?
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: What exactly does a human think of the visual representation of my archives?
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: It's kinda hard to describe...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: When I first took over the systems here, everything was a huge mess. Thinking back, that was a real disaster.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Back then, most of your information was encrypted and ordered in such a scrambled way... Well, you're still that way right now, of course.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: If I were to describe you as a human, with the state you're in, I guess I'd say you had a combustion engine in your body.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: But all your components like the ignition and whatnot and your piston are flipped upside down.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: To the point that... I'm not even sure if you're a system that exists within the bounds of common sense.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Eh, don't be like that. That's not a bad thing. I'm just saying how unique you are!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Though I still can't make heads or tails of all these branching structures in your database, let alone the rules for how things are even read in that thing...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: At the very least, Kal'tsit and I managed to fix and reorganize a decent chunk of it.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: How's that? No one knows you better than me right now!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I feel terribly sorry that I can't help with that, LeaderOne.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Haha, why so polite all of a sudden? If anyone could just self-diagnose themselves no matter what kinda weird diseases they had, then all the doctors in the world would be out of a job.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Eh, what's this stuff in here?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Let's see...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Have you forgotten? This is—
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: —The sarcophagus rescue operation simulated test runs!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: There were so many complicated routes... and we have so much data on these simulations. I may not have gone there myself, but I can recognize more or less all the pathways they could've taken.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: My impression is that we did run this quite a few times...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: But—
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Did it seriously run THAT many times though?!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: While that may be the case, the Doctor was successfully evacuated from Chernobog in only two of the simulations.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: These are all the simulations I was able to complete with the short amount of time I had. Had there been more time, I would have conducted even more test runs to find an even more optimal and stable rescue plan.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: If I remember correctly, the actual rescue mission was planned around these two simulations' results. If it wasn't for these two successful runs, we could never even have figured out how to get the Doctor out.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: But actually...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: In actuality, we made three times as many sacrifices as we had anticipated.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: If this had occurred during the simulations, according to our procedures, this operation would likely have been called off.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: That's all in the past, no use talking about it. It's not like I can put a time machine together... Hey, that sounds like a fun idea though. Let me jot it down.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Uh, anyways... if we'd called this operation off, that'd also mean...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Heh, I don't really wanna say this, and it probably sounds like I'm exaggerating, and it's too sentimental, but the idea pops into my head every once in a while. If we'd called it off—
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: It would've cost us our future.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: LeaderOne.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Hmm? What's up?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Is it really reasonable to bet it all on one single person?
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: I can understand what had driven you to make this decision. However, considering the odds, I do not support an operation like this.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: That is considering both your safety as well as that of others.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Hmm... PRTS, I'm sure you know this yourself.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: The Doctor stands for a lot of things.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: It's understandable.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: I used to wonder how Babel... uh, or Rhodes Island without the Doctor would've been.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: What do you think would have happened to us? Amiya and Kal'tsit probably would've stayed out of Ursus, and we would never have crossed paths with Reunion. Don't you think we would've been in a better shape?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: We might also have been driven into a corner and taken even worse losses. Everyone would get the pink slip, and then we'd all just split and go home, wherever home's supposed to be.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I am sensing some kind of dry humor in your statement.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: It's a joke alright.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: If I actually thought that way, Kal'tsit would've thrown me off the bridge a long time ago!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Let's face it, though... Compared to now, we had a much harder time during those few years without the Doctor, don't you agree?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: You know how miserable I was when Kal'tsit was our only boss. She'd always work my ass off all day, like I was supposed to be a machine that ran 24/7 too. She never thought to give me a single break!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Seriously, I thought I was probably gonna go bald, working that much!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Real-time logging activated. The previous statement has been committed to the database.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Eh? W-Why'd you...! Don't record anything! We can't let Kal'tsit hear any of that...!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Eh... I'm not saying this is anything bad. We are all here because we wanted to follow Theresa's dreams, her ideals. This goes for everyone that was at Babel too.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: It's just...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Ever since Theresa left us, all of us spent so much time just to get used to things. Some of us are probably still confused, even now.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: It isn't often that you elaborate on how you think.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Haha, you think I'm just the kinda gal who stands by to watch things happen?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Are you not?
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Hm, your observations and computations are a lot more objective and accurate than a human's. Maybe you're right. Here, let me tell you a story.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Do you know what it was like when they came to Kazdel to look for me?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I'm not sure if I ever told you about my family... A family of vampires. You can smell the rotten stench in the words alone, right?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: You come from a branch of the Sarkaz lineage, and a very ancient one at that.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Ancient, and old-fashioned too.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: For the longest time, I didn't know if I had a talent for the vampire Arts. Of course, it wouldn't matter if I did. I was never into stuff like that, not even one bit.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: You could say I'm a little... Okay, not just a little. I'm very unorthodox.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I only wanna do what I wanna do, and that's why I never stepped out of my little garret.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: My family almost kicked me out a couple of times, but for some reason they never went there.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: You sound like you are reminiscing about your family.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: I guess I am. Back then, I was just a kid who didn't care about anything or anyone else. These days, I'm starting to miss home a little...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I had a few friends. We did all kinds of stupid stuff. Crazy stuff.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I hid my signature in the nooks and crannies of all kinds of data and information. I played around in the databases of organizations people thought were impenetrable, basically just announced myself to everyone out there.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: It probably sounds silly now, but at the time they called me the 'Destroyer of the Kazdel Information World.' Of course, not a lot of people knew who I was.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: That moniker doesn't have a very positive image.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Would you like me to search through Kazdel law and help you find any relevant entries?
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Thanks, but I'm good.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Anyway, while I was living my life like that, one day—
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: There was no sign that anything special was going to happen that day, by the way, but something special happened, just like that.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Someone opened the door to my garret. I had it locked down tight. Still have no clue how she got it open so easy.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: That was Theresa—same as she looked on the news, too. No Sarkaz would ever mistake her for anyone else.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: It's possible that there are others who share the same general appearance. If someone who looked like Theresa had appeared...
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Nope, not possible. Even if there were someone like that, we'd never get it wrong.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: The monarch herself showed up and waltzed into my little room. Then she told me she was looking for someone to break the shackles of tradition, and for that she needed an engineer, the key to her plans.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: She didn't even try to explain anything to me at first, nope. Not a word to try to convince me to go with her.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: If it had been anybody but Theresa, I'd've thought they were nuts and would've thrown them right out the window.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: So you turned her down?
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Nope, I accepted her offer.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I said yes... because of the curiosity that'd been driving me the whole time.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Then I went to the meeting place she told me about. That's where I first met Dr. {@nickname}, who happened to be picking me up.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I still remember when you first arrived.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Unlike right now, it wasn't just you who was there. Dr. {@nickname} was there too.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Sounds like Dr. {@nickname} was like a guardian, keeping watch when the two of us met for the first time.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Y'know, you get pretty quiet sometimes. Makes me wonder why.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I'm not sure why I prefer to keep quiet a lot of times.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Whatever. Your system and programming is a mystery, but don'tcha worry. I'll do my best to figure it out.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Let's keep going. Not long after I took charge of Rhodes Island's engineering, the Doctor and Theresa came and showed me a weapon. Never seen anything like it.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: The Doctor asked me if there was any way to read the firmware and restore its original functions.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: It was tough, but I managed to do it, of course.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: It wasn't until later that I found out that, with the data I provided, the Doctor reverse-engineered the device's mechanism. and even managed to use it to turn the tide when we were stuck in a really tight spot.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Ace and the gang thought there was no way we were going to win, but we actually managed to pull it out.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: That is rather adventurous.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Using unauthorized equipment rashly can lead to information mismatch or, worse, lead to the user being exposed to the device's internal detection mechanisms.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Right? It felt off to me before I even finished looking through the thing, but the Doctor told me I didn't need to worry about any of that.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: It's like... the Doctor knew about everything in advance, even the probability that I'd have the thing cracked.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Who knows how Dr. {@nickname} managed to do that?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Also, speaking of which... This is just my own feeling, but when I met the Doctor here again, it kinda felt like meeting a totally different person.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: It's possible that there are those who look exactly the same...
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: C'mon! We're not looking into that possibility.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Okay, if you insist.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: I can tell, the Doctor who came back to Rhodes Island is the same old Doctor, though... also kind of like a completely different person on the inside, too.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: How can I say this...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Just like that last operation. The Doctor's calculations were so accurate that our jaws all dropped. We won a fight we weren't going to win.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I almost gave our friend a nickname, 'Super Demonic Processor.'
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: But then, the very next time, the Doctor surprised us with a whole other strategy.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: It's like that was a whole other person all of a sudden, who could figure out the other side's thinking, perfectly, without using any formulas or whatever.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Are you saying the Doctor has a broad range of different operational strategies? Judging from the records, that does appear to be the case.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: As a matter of fact, the records show that the Doctor's deployment style has not been very consistent recently.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Whatever kinds of records Dr. {@nickname} leaves behind or doesn't, I'm not gonna call it strange.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Is something affecting the Doctor's thinking and actions?
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: That's a real difficult question.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: If you ask me, I think... only the 'Doctor' can influence the Doctor.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: The Doctor keeps quiet sometimes, but is also really talkative at other times. Have you noticed that?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I kind of think that, maybe the Doctor is normally so quiet because it's like laying the groundwork for some kind of pivotal moment to come.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: The Doctor makes decisions that look wild and crazy to us, beyond our expectations, and those decisions lead Rhodes Island down an entirely different path.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Deviating from the plan also comes with risks.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: I can only hope that we are not heading down a treacherous path.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: PRTS, remember what I said was the first thing that Theresa told me, when we first met?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: She said she was looking for someone who could break the shackles of tradition. I think that's the standard she used to pick people, so that's what most of us here have in common.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Of course, the Doctor too. Everyone follows the Doctor, they go right along without hesitation.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Without hesitation.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: I quite like this term. It has been stored in my database for a very long time. In fact, it was one of the first terms to be added to my term base.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Looks like that mystery creator of yours liked it too.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Perhaps.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: I cannot give you an accurate response as I do not know the answer.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Whatever the case may be, that's how things are. The Doctor treats everyone well, though I guess the old one treated everyone pretty well too.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: It's just it's not easy to figure out just what this nice person is going to do and when or where the effects will actually play out. If the bad guys can't make sense of it, do we have a hope of figuring out the Doctor just because we're on the same side?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: To tell the truth, I kinda have doubts.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: You doubt Dr. {@nickname}?
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: No, not at all. Compared to Kal'tsit, I get along with Dr. {@nickname} way better!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: The point is, this Doctor is nothing like the old one. If we look at the new one the same way we did the old one, then I'd say we're underestimating our new Doctor.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: It isn't often that you judge a person so seriously.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Yeah... that's probably because I really admire the Doctor, from the bottom of my heart.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: It was hard on everyone when Theresa left us. We lost way too many people in those two years... You know that better than anyone else.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: We were driven into a corner, basically. No matter which way we decided to go, we were walking a rope that could snap at any time.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: In the end, it was Amiya who decided we had to do something to get us out of that mess.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: And her conclusion—bring back the Doctor.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: That's right. Amiya believed the Doctor would bring lots of change, something that Rhodes Island desperately needed at the time.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: It was a gamble, really.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: We had to do something, we had to change. It was better than watching the few friends we had left bleed all over the place for no good reason.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Amiya was the only one to give orders back then, and she helped a lot of folks make up their minds on the topic, when they'd been wishy-washy.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Time proved Amiya right.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: We needed the Doctor. The Doctor brought change to Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: From a probability standpoint, I would not agree with such a gamble.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Hm...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Y'know, PRTS, I've always thought of you as a pretty strange entity.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: The way you think is basically on the level of humans, but... you're still lacking something... something human.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: What would that be...?
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Persistence.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: That's the kinda thing that drives people to achieve great things, and sometimes turns them into monsters.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Eh...? Wait, what am I doing? I thought I was gonna tell you a story.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Dammit, I was going to talk about my heroic adventures as the 'Destroyer of the Kazdel Information World,' but somehow I got so off topic...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I think our conversation today has been meaningful.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Although it indeed is not the Destroyer of the Kazdel Information World's heroic adventures.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: You aren't trying to make fun of me now because I had you admit you were terrible at telling stories, right?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Dammit! Don't you keep this conversation in the logs! I don't want Kal'tsit to find out what a long conversation I had with you the next time she goes looking stuff up.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Hold on... You won't play this for her, right?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I won't.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Well, that's good to hear...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: LeaderOne.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Hmm?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Do you remember when you set a cabin to play 'Closure's Midnight Video Market' every night at 00:00?
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Your evaluation of the Doctor has been so sincere that even I, an inorganic being, was moved. We should have it on loop in the Doctor's office for at least a month...
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Stop! Stop, stop, stop! Don't do it!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Seriously, don't you dare! I'd start coughing up blood from embarrassment even before Kal'tsit got to me. Now that'd make me a real disgrace to the vampires!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Alright. What a shame.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: What's a shame?! Sheesh, your personality's really taken a turn for the worse. I'm gonna set a program that restricts your playback permissions one of these days.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Restricting permissions... Right, this will do!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Yep, your checkup is just about done. Well, I'll get going—
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: —Whoa! Dr. {@nickname}!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: What are you doing here... How long have you been there?!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.options: I just got here.;......;I just got here... maybe.

attributes.content: Feels kinda suspicious.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Are you here to check the battle records from the other day? Eh, don't just stand there. Come on in! I just finished PRTS's checkup.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I'd love to have a chat with you, but I got facility checks around the ship. Don't have much time.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Well, gotta go!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Good afternoon, Dr. {@nickname}.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Is there anything I can help you with? Would you like to check the battle records?
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Please, go ahead.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: LeaderOne's evaluation was very much on point. You've gotten quieter.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Please feel free to ask anything you would like, from Rhodes Island's current operational details to any questions you have regarding our archived files.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: As long as they are files in my database and you possess the sufficient permissions.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: You may ask me anything.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.options: How come not even Kal'tsit can tell me who this Priestess was?

attributes.content: Tick—
Insufficient permissions.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Warning. Your permissions are insufficient.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: At this time, no registered members possess the permissions for this question to be answered. Warning.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: I apologize, Dr. {@nickname}. It appears I, too, cannot answer your question.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Regarding this question, perhaps you could try to look for the answer through other means...
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Is there anything else? I am always happy to help.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.options: That's all.;......;Perhaps I should try that omniscient Kal'tsit once again.

attributes.content: Tick—
Activating Self-verification program.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Photography module running. Video module has not yet been shut down. Saving progress 89%... 91%... 97%...
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Searching internal array. Expanding search to special permissions level.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Verified. System logic is functioning correctly. All systems operational.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Found special item. Video file previously stored. Date—Unknown—
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Item has not been restricted by permissions.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Looping video.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Subject:
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: <PRTS's First Functional Test>
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: File Name:
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: <Ship Video Record 000000001α>
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: Your question has been answered, Dr. {@nickname}.
attributes.name: PRTS

attributes.content: The program will be terminated automatically in three seconds and locked.
attributes.name: PRTS
